SnapEvent.summary: NOTE Experimental The SnapEvent interface defines the event object for the and events. Respectively, these fire on a scroll container when the browser determines that a new scroll snap target is pending (will be selected when the current scroll gesture ends), and when a new snap target is selected.

remarks.para: These events can be used to run code in response to new elements being snapped to; SnapEvent exposes references to the element snapped to in the inline and/or block direction. The property values available on SnapEvent correspond directly to the value of the scroll-snap-type CSS property set on the scroll container:

- event
- event
-CSS scroll snap module
-Using scroll snap events
-Scroll Snap Events on developer.chrome.com (2024)

SnapEventSnapEvent.summary:
NOTE Experimental The SnapEvent() constructor creates a new
object instance.

remarks.para:
- event
- event
-CSS scroll snap module
-Scroll Snap Events on developer.chrome.com (2024)

SnapEventSnapTargetBlock.summary:
NOTE Experimental The snapTargetBlock read-only property of the
interface returns a reference to the element snapped to in the block direction when the event fired.

remarks.para: The property values available on SnapEvent correspond directly to the value of the scroll-snap-type CSS property set on the scroll container. snapTargetBlock only returns an element reference if the snap axis is specified as block (or a physical axis value that equates to block in the current writing mode) or both.

- event
- event
-CSS scroll snap module
-Scroll Snap Events on developer.chrome.com (2024)

SnapEventSnapTargetBlock.value: A representing the snapped element, or null if scroll snapping only occurs in the inline direction so no element is snapped to in the block direction.If the snapped element was a pseudo-element, the returned Node will be the owning element of that pseudo-element.

SnapEventSnapTargetInline.summary:
NOTE Experimental The snapTargetInline read-only property of the
interface returns a reference to the element snapped to in the inline direction when the event fired.

remarks.para: The property values available on SnapEvent correspond directly to the value of the scroll-snap-type CSS property set on the scroll container. snapTargetInline only returns an element reference if the snap axis is specified as inline (or a physical axis value that equates to inline in the current writing mode) or both.

- event
- event
-CSS scroll snap module
-Scroll Snap Events on developer.chrome.com (2024)

SnapEventSnapTargetInline.value: A representing the snapped element, or null if scroll snapping only occurs in the block direction so no element is snapped to in the inline direction.If the snapped element was a pseudo-element, the returned Node will be the owning element of that pseudo-element.
